title: Social Media Specialist Interview

Interview Questions: What experience do you have with posting on X platform?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Aveda Institute
Interview Descriptions: Interview was easy. They will ask about previous employment and how you handle difficult situations. They will then give you a tour of the facility and you’ll meet some of the instructors and students.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about us?

title: Facial Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Tallahassee, FL) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I initially interviewed for the position of facial educator with the Aveda Institute aka TSP. My first interview with corporate via zoom I was asked my salary expectations. I asked for my current rate of $30 an hour plus benefits including PTO. This would be about $50k before taxes. And a little over what a starting teacher makes in the state of Florida. I got a second in person interview. This went well and I received an offer of $20 an hour. 30-34 hours a week. Benefits are not applicable unless you work at least 35 hours a week and at $20 an hour it would be a little over $32k a year. To teach. When billion dollar company like Aveda pays less than the state of Florida for it's teachers and keeps them below benefits it's not surprising they keep advertising this position. Aveda, The Salon People. Estee Lauder corporate. Do better. Pay a living wage and offer benefits.
Interview Questions: 1.) I was asked my salary requirements. I told them and they seemed amenable. Went on to second interview and they offer me $10 an hour under what I asked for. 2.) They asked me why I wanted to work there. 3.) If I had the "heart" of a teacher. 4.) If I had ever "mentored" someone before.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: 5 step interview process that took over a month. Incredibly too long for the pay they offer. They need much more transparency about pay before going ask the way through that.
Interview Questions: 2 phone interviews, a demo, a full day shadowing, and then a final interview. They want strong, dedicated, passionate instructors.

title: SPA Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
Zoom interview due to covid which was fine.

The interview went well enough until I asked the tough questions. I.E. what is the pay or salary. I was told that this information cannot be disclosed until I was given a formal offer. 

HUGE RED FLAG. 

I happened to know for a fact what past instructors make so when they asked me what wage I would ask for I said $20 an hour or basically 40k a year. This is considerably low. Aveda pays 19% below the national average for adult educators at a trade school. This was however the wage past teachers made.  So that is what I asked for.

I also asked about advancement opportunities. They answered that "there was always certainly more work to do"

SECOND RED FLAG. Extra work should come with extra pay and advancement. More work for the same money is a pay cut. Simple as that.

All in all this school is still/constantly looking for educators and it's easy to see why. Low pay, long hours (13 hour days) and oh yes doing extra work (events and such unpaid). No thanks. I dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions:
-Experience.
-Education.
-My comfort level with teaching via zoom.

title: Cosmetology Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Davie, FL) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I came to the institute for a in person verbal interview as an alumni from the school. The in person went very well, and I was invited back for a practical on doing things the "Aveda way" mind I graduated about 8 years ago. I went home and I practiced the cut and color they wanted me to do. One instructor that wasn't management over saw my practical. Critical comments were made during my practical to me about how my techniques are outdated from what they do now. They didn't even want me to let the mannequin process the full time after application. After I was done I was dismissed rudely. No hand shake, no thank you for your time, nothing. I saw myself out. I never heard back. When I reapplied to try again a few months later they asked me when I was available to interview. I said I was free and then they ghosted me. I have the qualifications and standards to meet their requirements. I believe I was not hired due to having an alternative appearance although it was professional.
Interview Questions: What does Aveda mean to you? Would you be able to work the schedule? What are your strengths and what are your weaknesses?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: rescheduled my first interview TWO times. The first t time was meant to be a phone interview and they sent an email 5 minutes before my interview was supposed to start. Appears to be very unorganized.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a challenging work experience and how you handled it.

title: Educator Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a Face to face interview followed by a technical interview that showcases your knowledge on the subject. Must have a valid cosmetology license and must know or be willing to learn the Aveda way.
Interview Questions: A you familiar with the Aveda Mission?

title: Admissions Representative Interview

Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself

title: Cosmetology Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Aveda Institute in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Waited over 30 minutes which was fine. I spent about 45 minutes in the in person interview. Very relaxing atmosphere yet noticed a theme with numbers and time. Timing should come after you build your foundation. After the retail was talked about in a points matter I remembered..., oh yes, Estée Lauder owns them. I felt a bit sad knowing these students would think this is what clients care about. This is what corporate America cares about. There’s a way to do both. I thought this was not the way to teach the Aveda way I remembered. There was no talk about anything Aveda stood for. Zero about sustainability, giving back without getting something out of it and most of all caring about the world at all in any way, shape or form. The whole Aveda foundation has fallen to pieces.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had a student that was falling behind with a haircut or color?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Rochester Hills, MI) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: They kind of need to chill. The interview was an hour long and they’re hiring process is pretty extensive and takes forever and the paperwork is insane. It’s a hair salon and beauty spa...not oval office. And some of them were just weird and personal. Like they wanted full details of how I interact with other people, it also felt like a psychology appointment.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you stand up to people in an uncomfortable situation?

title: Part-time Sales Advisor Interview

Interview Descriptions: There was an online application that I completed and submitted. The next phase included a phone with the district HR manager. There was also a brief test that was required. The final step was an in-person interview with the Retail Manager.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in the industry?

title: Esthetics Instructor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Las Vegas, NV) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The executive director from Aveda Institute of Las Vegas was very condescending from the moment she met me. I handed her my resume and she asked if I went to Aveda and I said no. After that, the interview went downhill and didn’t even last 5 minutes. The only question she asked me was why I wanted to become an instructor.  
Even with my few years of spa experience as an Esthetician, I felt like she did not give me the time of day.  She probably judged me by the way I looked. I look a lot younger than I am. It was odd because she never asked about my past experience or anything related to that matter, other than the one question, so I assumed she judged me on that and on my credibility. The only reason why I applied was because the job description said it doesn’t matter if you weren’t a former student of Aveda or have any teaching experience, so I gave it a shot. Guess I was wrong. What I do know is that I got bad vibes from her and she made me feel inferior. I even followed up with a Thank You e-mail and explained to her that I felt that I didn’t have enough time to tell her about my passion about skincare career and the importance of wanting growth in the industry. No response. Next!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become an instructor?

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Bel Air, MD) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was okay, I felt like it went pretty well. They made it seem like they liked me, boy was I wrong . The lady was nice. Questions were interesting I guess
Interview Questions: Why did you want to teach?

title: Professional Development Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Westwood, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Aveda Institute, specifically the Westwood location, seems extremely unorganized and unprofessional with some of their practices. I was asked to interview for the Professional Dev. Counselor position. After the first interview I inquired about the salary. I was not given an answer until after my second interview. The position is hourly and was below my pay range so I denied the offer. I was then asked if I would be interested in taking a “new position” they were developing. It was said to be a salary and within my range. I was then asked to come back and interview and meet with a few people, including Jill Sharpe, the director a few times. I was asked to shadow for 4 hours on a weekday. This makes a total of 3 times I traveled to meet with them and over 8 hours  total at the school. I received a phone call about a week later stating that the did not get the position secured and they would only be able to offer the lower paying position. How unprofessional to proceed with a 4 hour shadowing day without even confirming the role within the company. I’m glad it did it work out.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a challenging student or their parents?

title: Educator Interview

Interview Descriptions: There was an initial in person interview with the director asking the typical interview questions about my goals, and why I believe I would qualify for the position. After that I got a phone interview by the HR department and then a practical to see I can perform services required.
Interview Questions: Would my life maintain balance working the hours required?

title: Admissions Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Orlando, FL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email to schedule a Skype interview.  We made an appointment for the following week.  I joined her on Skype and began answering questions.  I could tell that they were only interested in people who were former sales reps vs. HR or had recruiting backgrounds.  I think once she saw my looks (not young I am an experienced recruiter and a college grad), the interview for her was over.  I am guessing they only want people who look a certain way, young and heavily made up or young and more trendy.  This would I guess appeal to the type of people who would go to the institute.  She talked a lot about sales, not a lot about my experience in admissions at a local university.  She rushed thru every single question, not allowing me to elaborate because I knew my age (46) was a detriment.  So, the rest of the interview was just "for show."
Interview Questions: What type of matrix did you use to measure your sales goals?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Aveda Institute (Portland, OR) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was over 20 minutes late and did not apologise,I was about to leave as I don’t appreciate unprofessional conduct and if I had been 20 minutes late I doubt I would have been seen. Really unfriendly and didn’t listen to my answers to the questions, when I was halfway through a question and didn’t even finish the second half, she interjected with a new question.  Didn’t understand my professional background and clearly hadn’t reviewed my resume. I asked at the end when was the position starting and she responded as if I had asked “So when do I start?” Very negative experience.  I am new to the area but had some positive interviews today and last week so I realised its not the norm, I would stay away from Aveda if this is what the management is like.
Interview Questions: What is the best and worst manager you have had and why?

title: Instructor Interview

However I would not recommend it if you have an ounce of self respect. They go out of thier way to humiliate staff and hold educators responsible for everything
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Manager Interview
